Susie Cummins Ceramics

My Work

I’m a potter/ceramic artist based in the beautiful landscape of the Durham Dales in the North East of England.

I’m always inspired by some aspect of nature or even Pagan spirituality and I like to think that people are drawn to a piece because they are in some way connecting with the original source of inspiration.

Most pieces are thrown on the wheel; some are hand built and all of them are in a stoneware clay body.

I’m currently working on three main collections, which continue to evolve.

My work is available in Pineapple Gallery, Bishop Auckland, From Loft to Loved in Sedgefield, or please feel free to contact me to discuss your pottery-related desires.

Littoral

Living near the River Wear, and also being inspired by the limestone shoreline of my beloved Greek island, Halki, I find myself drawn to the littoral zone, where water connects to the land and creates submerged textures and colours.

Above the waterline there’s a feeling of constant search and chaos. Below is inner peace and spiritual energy. In the middle is littoral.

Because of the nature of the rough glaze, this collection is not food-safe.

Into The Woods

This earthy, functional collection of kitchen and tableware is inspired by beautiful local woodland, wild flower meadows, the abundance of rich red berries in the Autumn and the stark contrasts of Winter.

Bottles

I was recently asked by a friend to make a very small bespoke vessel in which to take some of their loved one’s ashes abroad, to scatter in their favourite place.

I’m now regularly asked to make them to hold the ashes of passed furry friends. Made to order, turn around time is approximately 3 weeks.
